intro: Althoffia puttkameri, commonly known as the water lily, is a aquatic plant belonging to the family Nychthemeraliaceae. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that float on the surface of still or slow-moving freshwater bodies. The plant has broad, floating leaves that provide shade and oxygen to the water, supporting aquatic life. Its roots anchor it in the mud at the bottom of ponds and lakes. Althoffia puttkameri is native to parts of Africa and is often found in wetlands and marshy areas.
